page.title: 01CLIFTON-ON-TEME
page.content: Despite its name{Clifton-on-Teme stands well above the river that gives its name to one of Englands most beautiful valleys .Six hundred feet above sea level,Clifton can justly claim to be one of the prettiest villages on the western borders of {Worcestershire;}quiet,compact and uncommercialised,it has not surprisingly,attracted many newcomers and its population now stands at around 600. The main part of the village is a {conservation area}and any new building is very carefully controlled. If there is cause for concern about the future, it lies in the distinct possibility that high transport costs and the village's popularity with senior citizens may denude the village of young people.
